data.title: 以至少 50 个字回答问题
data.content: "Would you rather attend a live performance or sporting event (such as a play, concert, or football game) or watch it on television? Why? Give specific reasons for your answer."
data.answer: Thanks to the advent of technology, nowadays, people do not need to watch live performances such as a concert or soccer tournaments. Rather, they could stay at home and enjoy the recap on television. Although this seems to have the potential to exceed the traditional appreciation for the convenience it proceeds, in my point of view, watching live events would still remain to be preferable to audiences. It is no doubt that televisions have brought entertainment events closer to congregations closer than ever. Instead of spending time on booking tickets, reserving fine seats, and queueing to get to the stadium and standing among the crowd, plays or sports watchers can simply observe their show with just a click of a remote. Moreover, technology offers event audiences various outlet functions, such as recap shows, volume control, and close-up scenes. With these advantages, show observers could not only save time and money but also be able to be facilitated with benefits.
